results.title: Egretta
results.brief_description: A life history of the four species of egrets commonly found in Australia, the white egret, the great egret, the white crane and the white heron.

results.title: Ego development: the core of a healthy personality(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur M Kaye and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the establishment of ego qualities and the setting and achievement of goals in very young children. Proper resolution of the conflict between biological, psychic, and societal demands leads to the establishment of a healthy ego

results.title: Eggs
results.brief_description: This film deals with the mass-production of eggs for commercial marketing, and illustrates the technological devices used to speed up the output of eggs per day. Correct feeding and care of the hens in the laying houses, the gathering of eggs from both open and trap nests, the cooling and automatic handling, grading, cleaning, and packing of the eggs for the market are studied.

results.title: Egghead's robot (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, Australian Council for Children's Film and Television and Milo Lewis
results.brief_description: A very funny comedy about Paul “Egghead” Wentworth, the son of an inventor, who makes a look-alike robot to do his chores and replace him at sports. All goes well until the robot is named “cricketer of the year”, then blows a fuse in the compost heap! Written by Leif Saxon. Rated: G

results.title: Egg-ceptional
results.brief_description: A deceptively simple film about an egg who doesn’t fit. Superb animation details the various stages of the production process where the egg who is ‘different’ fails to meet the required specifications. A film that operates on a number of levels ranging from lower primary concepts of colour, number and size to the more abstract concepts of conformity, individual differences, desire for acceptance, etc.

results.title: Egg
results.creator_credit: Anne Gilhooly, AFTRS and Nicole Mitchell
results.brief_description:
An elderly woman living alone in her suburban family home makes a friend - a fallen bird’s egg she finds in the local park. She takes Egg into her home, and into her heart.
A sensual and evocative film about lonliness, life and love.
Features Paulette Perry as the woman.

results.title: Egami
results.creator_credit: Victorian Women's Film Unit and Sue Ford
results.brief_description: In Egami, fashion mannequins are interpreted as women for sale, statues are erected for white men and war, and Melbourne landmarks are totalitarian monuments, in a work that’s exploration of Australian identity and feminism is still relevant today.

constellations_primary.name: Alternate histories and futures
constellations_primary.description: Sue Ford's Egami reimagines contemporary life through a feminist and colonial lens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Women’s Film Unit and Sue Ford
results.description: In Sue Ford’s radical short film Egami, Melbourne’s imposing Shrine of Remembrance is rebadged the “New Settlers’ Temple of Wars” by the artist’s intergalactic visitor, who observes from a spaceship. The Shrine is one of many familiar Melbourne landmarks rendered as totalitarian monuments, which have usurped the lands of ‘the Dreaming People’, of which there is no sign left except in Swanston St souvenir stores. In Egami, fashion mannequins are interpreted as women for sale, statues are erected for white men and war, and Hamer Hall is a survival bunker, in a work that’s exploration of Australian identity and feminism is still relevant today.
description_for_label: In Sue Ford’s radical short film Egami, Melbourne’s imposing Shrine of Remembrance is rebadged the “New Settlers’ Temple of Wars” by the artist’s intergalactic visitor, who observes from a spaceship. The Shrine is one of many familiar Melbourne landmarks rendered as totalitarian monuments, which have usurped the lands of ‘the Dreaming People’, of which there is no sign left except in Swanston St souvenir stores. In Egami, fashion mannequins are interpreted as women for sale, statues are erected for white men and war, and Hamer Hall is a survival bunker, in a work that’s exploration of Australian identity and feminism is still relevant today.

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.

results.title: Efftee entertainers
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: This film provides footage of the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films. These long forgotten ‘shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the 1930’s. Footage includes famous local comics, singers and dancers: Stan Ray, George Moon, Minnie Love and Keith Desmond.
